author: yperbasis
content: <@291925846556540928> <@425572898787426305> <@415548822983278593> <@543900561460822016> While EIP-6110 stipulates that block validation should be extended to check that the provided deposit requests match the expected ones, EIP-7002 is mute on the matter. I.e. it doesn't say explicitly that withdrawal requests provided in a block must match those returned by `read_withdrawal_requests`.  Looks like an omission from the spec. cc <@814151075601973278> <@976542403269910539>

author: m.kalinin
content:
There is a line in the spec below the system call routine description:
> Each withdrawal request must appear in the EIP-7685 requests list in the order they are returned from `dequeue_withdrawal_requests()`.
